alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meriden Rest Area, or 34 miles south of Torrington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Yoder, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Hawk Springs Campground and Hawk Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
